attributes.action: Make an application for EU membership no later than 1 year after leaving the EU
attributes.background:
Many people who voted to leave the European Union in the June 2016 referendum have changed their minds and a clear message that EU reform is needed has been sent and, we hope, received. 
We wish, in the interests of unity and prosperity, to reclaim the UK's place in the EU.

attributes.action: Build new coal fired power stations using low carbon emission technology..
attributes.background:
We have learned that Germany will build new coal fired power stations despite urging us to close ours.
By re-opening the UK's coal mines and building new power stations utilising low carbon technology, we can secure our country's energy needs for the forseeable future.

attributes.action: Mandatory and timely parliamentary debates for petitions with 100,000 signatures
attributes.background: Currently, petitions that reach 100,000 signatures do not require parliamentary debates. This is an inadequate and undemocratic response. Concerns expressed by large numbers of citizens, should invoke mandatory, timely parliamentary debates

attributes.action: Make it legal to listen to broadcasts not meant for the general public. (ATC)
attributes.background: It is illegal to provide air traffic control feeds from within the UK due to an outdated law that originated in 1942. The law states that although it is not illegal to sell, buy or own a scanning receiver in the UK, it must only be used to listen to transmissions meant to be broadcast to the public.
attributes.additional_details:
OfCom (the U.K. regulatory authority for communications) has stated on numerous occasions: "It is an offence to listen to any other radio services unless you are authorised by a designated person to do so." 

This means that it is illegal to listen to anything other than general reception. This is clearly a law that needs to be updated in light of the many educational uses for listening to aircraft communications. Furthermore, the original reasons for this law have long since become irrelevant.

attributes.action: Greater devolution of powers to Greater London - like Scotland, NI and Wales
attributes.background: Considering the size of London's population and the unique challenges it faces, London should have a similar say in these matters, with further powers devolved to the London Assembly and London given more control over its finances to focus on its own priorities.
attributes.additional_details:
Greater London is economically and socially distinct from England. We know this from recent polls and elections.

Areas with smaller populations and economies (London's being larger than many European nations) have gained powers through devolution, e.g. the Northern Ireland Assembly, Scottish Parliament and National Assembly of Wales. They are responsible for areas such as infrastructure, health and education as these countries are best suited to make their own decisions within their borders.

attributes.action: Let EU immigrants know what the plans are regarding their future in the UK
attributes.background:
Millions of EU citizens have been working in the UK for many years, many children were born in the UK from EU citizens, and as such, see Britain as their home as they grew up here and were taught the same values as all other British Children.
What conditions can you provide for them after Brexit?
attributes.additional_details:
Let EU immigrants know what the plans are regarding their future in the UK - immediately and without delay!

These families are all currently experiencing uncertainty and fear. Let them know what they can expect from the Government and don't keep them in the dark. They didn't have the right to vote in the Referendum, but they do have the right to know what will happen to their families, workplaces, mortgages, student loans and education, as well as safety and welfare.

attributes.action: Restore the historic boundary of Warwickshire.
attributes.background:
In 1974 the county of Warwickshire was broken up to make the fictitious region of West Midlands.
The local government act 1972 change Warwickshire's boundaries and took out the major cities.
Birmingham, Coventry, Edgbaston, Solihull, Sutton Coldfield and other area's should be returned.
attributes.additional_details: Edgbaston is the home of Warwickshire county cricket club.

attributes.action: Free public transport for teenagers.
attributes.background: Provide free public transport for teenagers (<20 years old). This will encourage green travel, reduce road fatalities and seriously injured for this age group and will help young job seekers to find work further from home without large travel cost burden.

attributes.action: Make petrol tax cheaper for sports car drivers
attributes.background: Because driving and running costs are already a lot. Petrol shouldn't be over priced so people can't drive how they want to drive Thierry performance cars

attributes.action: Create independent body to call re-elections if campaign promises are not kept
attributes.background:
Create an independent body to call snap elections/referendums, protecting our right to Democratic representation

Reverse the current trend of politicians basing campaigns on promises publicised to secure votes, then immediately discarded

Key promises must be identified+independently monitored
attributes.additional_details:
The Leave campaign's pre-vote promises: 
https://goo.gl/DuYSZg

4 key promises retracted in first 24 hours: https://goo.gl/i83HYK

9 key pre-election promises broken by Tory Gov't in 1st 100 days: http://goo.gl/ZkgEqa

More pre-election promises immediately discarded: http://goo.gl/H3pnZM

If we are unable to vote on issues we want represented then we do not live in a functioning democracy

Intentions should be clearly stated as separate from promises. Promises should include dates for review

attributes.action: Make it a requirement to hold a UK Election within a year of any change of PM
attributes.background: New PM'S should have a mandate from the people they govern, rather than a few party members.  As such a new UK GENERAL Election should be held within 1 year of a new PM being appointed so he or she can claim to lead the People as PM with a proper mandate.

attributes.action: Change how the UK is governed to better serve and protect the British public.
attributes.background: Currently the key decision makers in the UK in the House of Lords are un-elected. They are appointed by being vetted by the Appointments Commission, then approved by the prime minister and formalised by the Queen. We feel that all aspects of our Government, especially key members should be elected.
attributes.additional_details:
We demand that:

All members of the House of Lords are appointed by the public's vote only and each members term is subjected to a vote every 5 years.

If voted out, their position is to be replaced by a member elected by public vote.

Membership is to open to all current and former MP's.
 
If a MP is currently serving when elected to the House of Lords, their local position is to be replaced by a member of their own party. This member is to be elected by the people in their constituency only.

attributes.action: Improve the representation of the British people in the UK parliament.
attributes.background:
We ask that parliament gives the British people a yes/no referendum on this question by June 2019:

“Do you want the UK to have an elected second house to represent the regional needs of the British people and proportional representation in the House of Commons to form all future governments?
attributes.additional_details:
There has been a growing need for reform of our democratic system for the last few decades. 

We feel that this is needed to improve communication between the political elite and the British people and to make our democracy more representative of the full spectrum of the view points held by our citizens.

attributes.action: Set a date for a Scotland independence referendum
attributes.background: The U.K. Eu referendum result is not supported by the majority in Scotland. A further referendum should be run to determine if Scotland wishes to remain in Europe.

attributes.action: Remove the 'triple lock' on pensions and protect the NHS from further cuts
attributes.background: Over 70% of pensioners backed the Leave vote to force Britain out of the EU and likely into a recession. The taxpayer pays more for pensions, than for healthcare, but unlike health the 'triple lock' on pensions guarantees increases of at least 2.5%, inflation or average earnings, whichever is higher
attributes.additional_details:
In 2015, £150bn was spent of taxpayer money on pensioners who voted to leave the EU. This looks certain to mean another recession and another round of austerity. The NHS can't take any more cuts, we were told during the referendum, so let's protect healthcare spending and cut pensions for those who clearly think we can afford a recession.
http://www.ukpublicspending.co.uk/budget_pie_ukgs.php

attributes.action: For EU motions to be urgently debated in Parliament offering a range of outcomes
attributes.background: Next steps for Parliament is far from clear or defined in law. An urgent Commons debate should offer a range of motions from each side of the campaign with full analysis of issues and offering a range of options moving forward. Any parliamentary outcome should be accompanied by wider consultation.

attributes.action: The Government to ensure EU funding is replaced on a like-for-like basis.
attributes.background:
A large number of projects across a wide field of endeavor, including such diverse things as scientific research and urban regeneration, are currently funded by the EU. As the UK disengages itself from the EU this funding will be withdrawn.
This could lead to many vital projects being abandoned.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for workers in dog shelters to kill unwanted dogs.
attributes.background: In dog shelters, workers kill unwanted dogs after a certain amount of time, which can be up to a week which doesn't give the dog a chance to live in a happy home where it is wanted. Dogs have feelings too, dogs are a man's best friend!
attributes.additional_details: http://www.dogwatchuk.com/death-row-dogs/
attributes.creator_name: Fiona Grezda, Jasmine Murphy, Alma Roe

attributes.action: Decrease length of employment time needed to qualify for paternity leave.
attributes.background: I hadn't realised until recently how poor paternity rights in this country are. It is unfair and ridiculous that a man needs to have worked 26 weeks, 15 weeks before the due date, at a company in order to simply qualify for 1 week off work to spend time with his child and the mother.
attributes.additional_details: This is completely disproportionate to the amount of time the father gets off work. It is an important time for both parents as they bond with their child, and indeed a difficult time as they both learn to be parents. It is against every idea of fairness and equality, British values, that fathers do not automatically qualify for at least 1 week for paternity. The length of time they have to have worked there simply must be reduced, and for that matter they should be able to apply for more.

attributes.action: A review of the British High Comission Visa Department in Pakistan.
attributes.background: The British High Comission has been rejecting thousands of UK Visa applicants from Pakistan in a unsophisticated way. So I plead to the British Government to review the ongoing in Pakistan's visa department, as rate of rejection is currently higher than ever, and this is not humanly right.
attributes.additional_details: Currently, the British High Commission charges fees from Rs14,000 to Rs100,000 for visas of different categories and durations. In some cases Pakistanis have submitted a number of a applications to the BHC for visas, and paid the fee a number of times, only to be turned down without a justifiable reason. This could be in fear of terrorism, which is understandable at the current time, however this does not highlight why thousands of applicants are being tuned down without a justified reason.

attributes.action: Make the government increase funds to support youth mental health.
attributes.background:
Due to national bed shortages in mental health units, many young people have been forced to move over 200 miles away from home, leaving loved ones behind.

0.6% of the NHS budget goes into helping young people with mental health, this is not enough.

attributes.action: Provide 'Be a Tree' training to children in schools.
attributes.background: I would like to see training provided to children in schools as to how to behave around dogs, in particular, the method of 'Be a Tree'.  The rationale behind this is in order to help prevent dog bites as a number of parents/adults are not aware of the behaviours that can lead to them.
attributes.additional_details: Dogs are stimulated by noise and movement. Unfortunately most children will be running around making a noise when they meet dogs. There are many kits already available, specifically aimed at teachers, such as http://www.clickertraining.com/node/3535 or http://www.be-a-tree.com/. It would be very easy for the Government to develop something similar for use in schools and is an easy way to educate everyone, as I'm sure children could be encouraged to impart what they have learned to their family.

attributes.action: Allow Gamaniel Josh Pensee to remain in the UK following notice of deportation
attributes.background: Gamaniel Josh Pensee is an accomplished amateur boxer who is due to be deported to his country of birth, he has no ties or means of living. Living in the UK since a child and boxing throughout, he is set to turn pro. The popular and friendly character inspires all, he is expecting his first child
attributes.additional_details: Gamaniel Josh Pensee is a 27 and soon to be father. He came to England with his mother aged 14 and believed he had permission to live here after his mother was granted indefinite leave to remain whilst he was still a child. It wasn’t until he tried to apply to University in his 20’s that he was made aware that his mother’s status had not automatically applied to him. After appointing a lawyer and adhering to bail conditions whilst he has sought to be granted the same status as his mother, he was suddenly detained on 13th April 2016. He was soon after issued with a notice of intention for his deportation

attributes.action: Make solar renewable energy a government-led initiative
attributes.background: While it has been often argued that the United Kingdom is a leader in the field of renewable energy, this has primarily been accomplished by the actions of private British businesses and not the actions of the government. It is most certainly time for the government to take its place in the sun.
attributes.additional_details: It is our goal, as it should be the goal of every person both of and on these islands and elsewhere on this planet, to protect it for future generations. There is no doubt in the minds of scientists that a future including humans must be a future of renewable and clean energy. We therefore recommend that the government require all of its properties, and those owned by its representatives of the people of both the upper and lower chambers, to, within a period of five years, possess solar panels.

attributes.action: Charge us more national insurance and properly fund the NHS
attributes.background: The NHS is now running at a huge defecit. This can be easily solved. Charge us more national insurance - double it if you like. Use that money to properly/sustainably fund the NHS for a growing, ageing population. We'd much rather fund a public system for all than pay for private health insurance.

attributes.action: Compel Bookmakers to accept £100 wagers and ban closing accounts
attributes.background: Bookmakers are systematically closing accounts of any punter with even short term profits.this is totally contrary to them being licenced to accepting bets.A modest figure of £100 would hardly lay them open to nefarious acts but would equally give a fair deal.
attributes.additional_details: I am sure several thousands respondents will support this ,all with similar stories.

attributes.action: Stop job discrimination against returning British Citizens
attributes.background: Government Departments have subcontracted recruitment companies (E.g. Capita) to manage the recruitment on their behalf. Some of these companies do not put forward candidates who have no been living in the UK for the past 3 - 5 years. This excludes British Citizens from working in the UK.

attributes.action: Make letting agents pay double the holding deposit for cancelling a tenancy.
attributes.background: Currently, letting agents require future tenants to immediately pay holding fees which is later offset against administration and referencing fees. However if letting agent chose to cancel the tenancy, they just return the holding fees and not any interest rate or penalties.
attributes.additional_details: If a letting agent cannot make the property available as per agreed tenancy start date And if the tenancy agreement was not signed by both parties until that time, then tenant has no rights and has to bear substantial consequential losses. If tenant decides to negotiate and threaten to take to property ombudsman (for breach of implied contract), the letting agent can cancel the offer for tenancy by returning just the initial monies with no interest rate and with no penalty.

attributes.action: Right to choose our own school holidays passed to parents
attributes.background: I would like to see the right to flexible school holidays passed to the parents and not just governed by local councils and schools. The old system is out of date and does not reflect modern living where both parents work.
attributes.additional_details: We as parents should have the choice to take our children out of school for the 20 days holiday that the government says we are entitled to as full time employees in this country. Schools should be open 50 weeks of the year with a only a week at Christmas and Easter as compulsory terms. All other holidays should be chosen by parents with a minimum of 4 weeks to be taken during the year but obviously not during exam times.

attributes.action: Debate parking on pavements. This practice is a danger to all
attributes.background: I went blind just last year, I have sustained many injuries walking into parked cars, I was even hit on the main road by a hit and run car and sustained minor injuries. I am afraid now to go out. The practice is a danger for disabled, the Blind, Children & Mothers with push chairs.
attributes.additional_details:
This dangerous practice is an obstruction for Disabled people and Mothers with pushchairs and young children having to be forced into the road to pass the vehicle and is a very dangerous manoeuvre I have hundreds of photographs of cars, vans and large lorries parked fully on the footpath and other cars illegally parked which can be sent if you need them. 
And copies of statements of people on social media who believe it is their god given right to park on the pavement outside their house.

attributes.action: Mass build affordable homes to rent or buy. People can't afford to live!
attributes.background: House prices have increased to such a degree that even if you are approved for a mortgage, a moderate increase in interest rates will result in crippling poverty. For many a mortgage is impossible. Rent increases faster than wages. Isn't it time to address this problem?

attributes.action: Companies to have Defibrillators
attributes.background:
Make it a mandatory requirement for businesses who employ over 50 persons either temporary or permanent to have a AED Automatic external defibrillator.
More than 100 Sudden Cardiac Arrests (SCA) take place in the UK each week with 95% of these being at a workplace.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.suddencardiacarrest.co.uk/

attributes.action: Introduce laws to prevent companies using pension funds for any other purpose
attributes.background: Companies are continually reporting a black hole in pension funds also when companies go bust the pension fund is empty.

attributes.action: Restrict the maximum working hours of NHS staff to avoid mistakes being made.
attributes.background: This petition calls for the creation of legislation which limits the working hours of health care professionals who make decisions which affect patient safety, with the aim of preventing mistakes due to tiredness. It should be similar to GB and EU rules which restrict working hours for drivers.
attributes.additional_details:
Working long hours can lead to tiredness, which in turn can lead to dangerous mistakes being made. This is the reason for the existence of both GB domestic and EU legislation which restricts the number of hours drivers can work for in a week, how long they can drive for without a break and how long their breaks must be.

As NHS staff are often in situations at work where making a mistake can have extremely serious affects on patients health, a safe legal limit to working hours should apply.

attributes.action: Increase refuge spaces for male survivors of domestic violence
attributes.background: Currently there are only 11 government funded refuge places for male survivors of domestic violence yet 40% of domestic violence is against males

attributes.action: Make it so that gender segregation, within P.E at school, is no longer allowed.
attributes.background: School's have become accustomed to separating genders in P.E. This is understandable in contact sports, such as Rugby, but why should it be so in non-contact sports. Sign this petition so that gender segregation is a thing of the past!

attributes.action: Make it law that all public toilets should have baby changing facilities.
attributes.background: Because fathers either have to give their child to a women to take into the ladies toilet to change their nappy, or change their child on the floor of the mens bathroom. It is a violation of the discrimination act that baby changing facilities are not found in mens restrooms.

attributes.action: Omit the requirement for a TV License in HM Forces Single Living Accommodation
attributes.background: At present all serving personnel in HM Forces Single Living Accommodation require a TV License. An exemption should be made for Forces personnel on HM establishments whom reside due to a duty move.
attributes.additional_details:
Many serving personnel temporarily reside at HM establishments throughout the week, thus require a TV License for two addresses. The one exemption to the rule is that a TV can be watched on a license for another address if the device is battery operated and not mains powered.  iaw http://www.tvlicensing.co.uk/check-if-you-need-one/for-your-home/armed-forces-personnel-aud7.
Serving personnel are requested to move frequently to temporary locations for training courses.

attributes.action: Enabled Payment for School Dinners with Child Care Vouchers
attributes.background: For a family with 2 children, school dinners cost in the region of £900 per year. With family costs rising rapidly and well ahead of wages, this is becoming increasingly unaffordable for many parents.
attributes.additional_details:
More than one in five children at some primary schools in England start their first and final years of primary school underweight, figures show.

Allowing school meals to be paid for with childcare vouchers would ease family costs and increase take-up rate.

Hence, we hereby petition the Government to make it possible to pay for School Dinners via the Child Care Vouchers scheme.

attributes.action: ASPA'86 revised to ban use of animal testing and selling of tested goods in UK.
attributes.background: Since 1882 the use of animal testing has been reduced. But when the media states a reduction, it compares from the horrific state of which we treated animals to a position where we were only capable of improvement. In this age, 2016, is it still acceptable for this inhumane act to continue?
attributes.additional_details:
Most figures displayed by the media do not include animals that are bred for the purpose of testing and for use of tissue
then discarded or rejected because their genetic modifications did not work.
Use of animals:
Rodents 84%
Fish, amphibians, reptiles 12%
Large mammals 2.1%
Small mammals 1.4%
Dogs and cats 0.3%
Primates 0.1%
Scientists suggest that new drugs in development that act in very specific ways in the body may lead to more animals (specifically primates) being used in future years.

attributes.action: Start the process for UK to join the EURO monetary union
attributes.background:
Dismiss the outcome of the Brexit referendum recognising that was a mistake (clear example of why direct democracy does not work).
Give a strong signal to Europe and the World with the access of UK to the European monetary union.
attributes.additional_details: Show that UK knows that together we are stronger and that the fully developed union of the European people, more than the economic and monetary union, is the right path towards the future of UK, Europe and the World.

attributes.action: Make it law to carry a breakdown warning triangle in every motor vehicle.
attributes.background: If a warning triangle is displayed 100 metres behind a broken down vehicle, it will decrease the chances of someone else crashing into it. What if you had broken down somewhere awkward like a roundabout or a bridge without a hard shoulder?
attributes.additional_details:
It is already mandatory in France to carry a warning triangle.

It alerts other road users to a breakdown so they have enough time to react.

It is very effective on motorways where there is no hard shoulder.

It is known to reduce the amount of accidents involving broken down vehicles.

attributes.action: Get the government to remove stamp duty from buy-to-let property
attributes.background: The btl mortgages have dropped 60% since April when George Osborne brought in the states on btl and 2nd homes. This is damaging the housing market and the rental market for both renters and 1st time buyers

attributes.action: Make it illegal for a parent to allow child access to age inappropriate material
attributes.background: This needs to happen sooner rather than later because the technology is becoming more of the norm for young impressionable children and games that glorifying gang affiliations, drug dealing , mass shootings act now for our next generation of leaders

attributes.action: Stop educational institutes in the UK from sending farm animals off to slaughter
attributes.background: It has come to our attention that some educational institutes in the UK such as colleges that teach Land-based courses are raising farm animals to be slaughtered for meat. Enough animals in the UK are being farmed for meat and the practice is simply unnecessary. What do the students gain from this?
attributes.additional_details: Some students at the colleges who carry out this practice have been affected and none of the students were aware of the practice before signing up for Land-based courses. A parent of a student who suffered the same trauma of raising animals destined for the slaughterhouse quoted: “We don’t agree that this is how animals should be treated - especially at a learning facility." There are also many viable alternatives for the animals raised such as being released to a sanctuary.

attributes.action: Have older drivers be assessed free of charge once hitting a particular age.
attributes.background: Every year thousands of UK drivers are involved in a road traffic collision of some kind and unfortunately a lot are OAP's. For some older people there reaction times and awareness on the road are limited.
attributes.additional_details: A goverment funded assessment should be put into place to assess any older drivers once they hit a particular age to be passed as safe to be on UK roads. By doing this thousands of lives can be saved and while not every driver above a particular age is unsafe on the road many are also unaware of there dangerous driving style. Help save lives by supporting a goverment funded assessment to unsure everyone is safe on the road.

attributes.action: Nationalise Utility companies and regenerate UK infrastructure with the profits.
attributes.background: The privatised utility companies run a virtual monopoly with an arcane pricing structure designed to confuse. There was no evidence of significantly more inefficiency when they were previously in public ownership and unlike transport we all rely absolutely on utility companies for our wellbeing.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that given the option the majority of people in the UK would support a return to public ownership,  regardless of political persuasion. If necessary this might be an option for the larger metropolitan areas to run as pilot schemes initially , with a local poll conducted independently of any political party.

attributes.action: Make the use of parent and child parking spaces in car parks badge holders only!
attributes.background: When parking with young children in car parks extra door space is needed. Most car parks provide this facility but unfortunately some people don't think they need to have children in the car to use these spaces. I think the introduction of a badge system to use these spaces is needed to stop this.
attributes.additional_details: Every time I use or try to use these spaces that are provided for parents with children I see others use them with no children in the car. I think that this lack of consideration is very infuriating and every parent I have spoken to agrees. At one time or another I'm sure like me you have struggled to get your children out of a small space because maybe that last space had been taken by someone who didn't actually need it. If you agree with me please sign this petition

attributes.action: Keep present allowances for disabled and assisted accomodation tenants.
attributes.background: The present efforts by the government to attack the poorest and most vulnerable in our society must stop.I work with both the disabled and the homeless who do not have a voice. Help me and sign this petition to be their voice.
attributes.additional_details: Rental allowances from benefit are capped and often fall short of the required amount- which then has to be topped up from benefits- often leaving individuals with less than £60 a week for all their needs (food, toiletries, transport, household goods etc) This is inhuman treatment of the most vulnerable in our society who need our help and support.The allowances should be kept and increased yearly in line with the cost of living index.

attributes.action: Make it law that all bus companies must have space for 2 wheelchairs and a Pram
attributes.background:
Were asking that we catch up with mainland europe when it comes to disability access especially on transport such as buses who currently only allow one wheelchair and a pram.

Disabled people travel together and to expect them to catch separate buses so they can go out together is disgraceful!
attributes.additional_details:
Its time we caught up with mainland europes public transport giving a minimum of 2 priority wheelchair spaces on each bus and a space for 1 or 2 prams.

Wheelchair users find it hard to use public transport but if your a wheelchair user with another friend whos a wheelchair user you find it impossible to go out together as you have to take separate buses some which could be an hour apart.

Its time the companies providing the service were made to make this a requirement making it fairer for all
